H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7300.def: = state in which humans are unwilling to accept a certain situation

H1949.def: = process by which an area trembles ◄ as a result of the noise of a multitude of people

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H7852.def: = state in which humans harbor resentment against (other) humans for things they did in the past

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H6427.def: = process by which the human body shakes, ◄ as a result of fear

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H83.def: = part of the body ◄ of a bird, ► used for flying

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H4655.def: = a place where humans find shelter

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H6385.def: = process by which an object is divided into two or more parts

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H2346.def: = structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H441.def: = person in a position of leadership over a tribe or clan

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4985.def: = state in which food tastes well

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3451.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H4033.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H6153.def: = the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7128.def: = armed conflict in which weapons are used to attack an enemy

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2487.def: = set of inanimate objects that belong together

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H4260.def: = coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into {L:cheese<SDBH:חָרִיץ>} or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

H7128.def: = armed conflict in which weapons are used to attack an enemy

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7401.def: = causative process by which a hard surface is made soft

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H6609.def: literally: opened sword; hence: = {L:sword<SDBH:חֶרֶב>} that has been removed from its scabbard ► in order to harm someone else

4.gl: to lay (one's) hands (on someone or something)

H3053.def: literally: a heavy load to be carried; hence: = a matter of concern that affects someone deeply; ◄ as if it were a heavy load

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3557.def: = state in which a container is able to accomodate something within its available space

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H2673.def: = state in which an object is divided into two or more parts

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
